Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrole kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrolebinding kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'kube-state-metrics' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'kube-state-metrics' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'kube-state-metrics' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'kube-state-metrics' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics' should set 'resources.requests.memory'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.memory'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'kube-state-metrics' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics' should set 'resources.limits.memory'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.memory'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with UID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'kube-state-metrics' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with GID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'kube-state-metrics' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to an integer > 10000.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: deployment kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics in  namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrole kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics-psp in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Message: serviceaccount kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics in  namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: servicemonitor kube-prometheus-kube-state-metrics in  namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host network
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the host’s loopback adapter.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'kube-prometheus-node-exporter' should not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host PID
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s PID namespace allows visibility on host processes, potentially leaking information such as environment variables and configuration.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'kube-prometheus-node-exporter' should not set 'spec.template.spec.hostPID' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.template.spec.hostPID' to true.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'node-exporter' of DaemonSet 'kube-prometheus-node-exporter' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'node-exporter' of DaemonSet 'kube-prometheus-node-exporter' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.

Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'HostPath Volumes', HostPath volumes must be forbidden.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'kube-prometheus-node-exporter' should not set 'spec.template.volumes.hostPath'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.volumes[*].hostPath'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Kubernetes resource with disallowed volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: HostPath present many security risks and as a security practice it is better to avoid critical host paths mounts.
Misconfigurations.Message: daemonset kube-prometheus-node-exporter in  namespace shouldn't have volumes set to {"/proc", "/sys"}
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not Set 'spec.volumes[*].hostPath.path' to any of the disallowed volumes.

Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ":latest" used
Misconfigurations.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'alertmanager' of Alertmanager 'kube-prometheus-alertmanager' should specify an image tag
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.

Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'blackbox-exporter' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-blackbox-exporter' should set 'resources.limits.memory'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.memory'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with UID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'blackbox-exporter' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-blackbox-exporter' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with GID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'blackbox-exporter' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-blackbox-exporter' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to an integer > 10000.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: deployment kube-prometheus-blackbox-exporter in  namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: service kube-prometheus-blackbox-exporter in  namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: serviceaccount kube-prometheus-blackbox-exporter in  namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kube-prometheus-operator' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: No wildcard verb roles
Misconfigurations.Description: Check whether role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Message: Role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on specific resources

Misconfigurations.Title: No wildcard verb roles
Misconfigurations.Description: Check whether role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Message: Role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on specific resources

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes workloads and pods
Misconfigurations.Description: Depending on the policies enforced by the admission controller, this permission ranges from the ability to steal compute (crypto) by running workloads or allowing for creating workloads that escape to the node as root and escalation to cluster-admin.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kube-prometheus-operator' should not have access to resources ["pods", "deployments", "jobs", "cronjobs", "statefulsets", "daemonsets", "replicasets", "replicationcontrollers"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Kubernetes workloads resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes workloads and pods
Misconfigurations.Description: Depending on the policies enforced by the admission controller, this permission ranges from the ability to steal compute (crypto) by running workloads or allowing for creating workloads that escape to the node as root and escalation to cluster-admin.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kube-prometheus-operator' should not have access to resources ["pods", "deployments", "jobs", "cronjobs", "statefulsets", "daemonsets", "replicasets", "replicationcontrollers"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Kubernetes workloads resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage configmaps
Misconfigurations.Description: Some workloads leverage configmaps to store sensitive data or configuration parameters that affect runtime behavior that can be modified by an attacker or combined with another issue to potentially lead to compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kube-prometheus-operator' should not have access to resource 'configmaps' for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'configmaps'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes networking
Misconfigurations.Description: The ability to control which pods get service traffic directed to them allows for interception attacks. Controlling network policy allows for bypassing lateral movement restrictions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kube-prometheus-operator' should not have access to resources ["services", "endpoints", "endpointslices", "networkpolicies", "ingresses"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Networking resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrole kube-prometheus-operator in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'prometheus-operator' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-operator' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'prometheus-operator' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-operator' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'prometheus-operator' of Deployment 'kube-prometheus-operator' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.memory'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ":latest" used
Misconfigurations.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'config-reloader' of Prometheus 'kube-prometheus-prometheus' should specify an image tag
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ":latest" used

Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'prometheus' of Prometheus 'kube-prometheus-prometheus' should specify an image tag
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'config-reloader' of Prometheus 'kube-prometheus-prometheus' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
